extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 1, TAX CUTS AND JOBS ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 208

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to the motion to concur in the Senate amendment to H.R. �D1350�1, to provide for reconciliation pursuant to titles II and V of the concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 2018, by a yea-and-nay vote of 224 yeas to 201 nays, Roll No. 699.<P/>H. Res. 668, the rule providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 1) was agreed to by a yea-and-nay vote of 232 yeas to 190 nays, Roll No. 698, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 234 yeas to 188 nays, Roll No. 697.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to the motion to concur in the Senate amendment to H.R. �D1350�1, to provide for reconciliation pursuant to titles II and V of the concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 2018, by a yea-and-nay vote of 224 yeas to 201 nays, Roll No. 699.<P/>H. Res. 668, the rule providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 1) was agreed to by a yea-and-nay vote of 232 yeas to 190 nays, Roll No. 698, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 234 yeas to 188 nays, Roll No. 697.

congVote.result: So the motion to concur was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to the motion to concur in the Senate amendment to H.R. �D1350�1, to provide for reconciliation pursuant to titles II and V of the concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 2018, by a yea-and-nay vote of 224 yeas to 201 nays, Roll No. 699.

The House agreed to the motion to concur in the Senate amendment to H.R. �D1350�1, to provide for reconciliation pursuant to titles II and V of the concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 2018, by a yea-and-nay vote of 224 yeas to 201 nays, Roll No. 699.<P/>H. Res. 668, the rule providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 1) was agreed to by a yea-and-nay vote of 232 yeas to 190 nays, Roll No. 698, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 234 yeas to 188 nays, Roll No. 697.

extension.searchTitle: UNITED STATES AND ISRAEL SPACE COOPERATION ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 208

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: United States and Israel Space Cooperation Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: H.R. 1159, amended, to provide for continuing cooperation between the National Aeronautics and Space Administration and the Israel Space Agency, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 411 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 700.

titleInfo.title: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE REFORM AND TRANSPARENCY ACT OF 2017

extension.searchTitle: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE REFORM AND TRANSPARENCY ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 208

congVote.result: So the motion to recommit was rejected.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Corporate Governance Reform and Transparency Act of 2017
Corporate Governance Reform and Transparency Act of 2017
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 4015, to improve the quality of proxy advisory firms for the protection of investors and the U.S. economy, and in the public interest, by fostering accountability, transparency, responsiveness, and competition in the proxy advisory firm industry, by a yea-and-nay vote of 238 yeas to 182 nays, Roll No. 702.<P/>Rejected the Sarbanes motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Financial Services with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with amendments, by a yea-and-nay vote of 189 yeas to 231 nays, Roll No. 701.

The House passed H.R. 4015, to improve the quality of proxy advisory firms for the protection of investors and the U.S. economy, and in the public interest, by fostering accountability, transparency, responsiveness, and competition in the proxy advisory firm industry, by a yea-and-nay vote of 238 yeas to 182 nays, Roll No. 702.<P/>Rejected the Sarbanes motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Financial Services with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with amendments, by a yea-and-nay vote of 189 yeas to 231 nays, Roll No. 701.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 115-46 shall be considered as adopted.

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Corporate Governance Reform and Transparency Act of 2017
Corporate Governance Reform and Transparency Act of 2017
Corporate Governance Reform and Transparency Act of 2017
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 4015, to improve the quality of proxy advisory firms for the protection of investors and the U.S. economy, and in the public interest, by fostering accountability, transparency, responsiveness, and competition in the proxy advisory firm industry, by a yea-and-nay vote of 238 yeas to 182 nays, Roll No. 702.

The House passed H.R. 4015, to improve the quality of proxy advisory firms for the protection of investors and the U.S. economy, and in the public interest, by fostering accountability, transparency, responsiveness, and competition in the proxy advisory firm industry, by a yea-and-nay vote of 238 yeas to 182 nays, Roll No. 702.<P/>Rejected the Sarbanes motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Financial Services with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with amendments, by a yea-and-nay vote of 189 yeas to 231 nays, Roll No. 701.

The House passed H.R. 4015, to improve the quality of proxy advisory firms for the protection of investors and the U.S. economy, and in the public interest, by fostering accountability, transparency, responsiveness, and competition in the proxy advisory firm industry, by a yea-and-nay vote of 238 yeas to 182 nays, Roll No. 702.<P/>Rejected the Sarbanes motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Financial Services with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with amendments, by a yea-and-nay vote of 189 yeas to 231 nays, Roll No. 701.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 115-46 shall be considered as adopted.

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to the Speaker's approval of the Journal by a yea-and-nay vote of 217 yeas to 194 nays with two answering ``present'', Roll No. 703.
